title: ESA’s Vigil space weather mission balances operational and scientific demands
summary: Vigil could provide notice of four to five days of high-speed winds streaming toward Earth.

title: Falcon 9 launches Cygnus cargo spacecraft to space station
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 successfully launched a Northrop Cygnus cargo spacecraft to the International Space Station for the first time Jan. 30.

title: Quindar raises $6 million for automation of satellite constellation operations
summary: Quindar has raised an additional $6 million to further development of software to automate operations of satellite constellations.

title: DLR Validate Miniaturized Satellite Laser Ranging Solution
summary:
Following a year of testing, the German space agency DLR has validated that its miniaturized satellite laser ranging (SLR) solution is a realistic alternative to traditional solutions. With SLR, a ground station fires a laser beam in short pulses at a target satellite in orbit. The beam hits the target and is reflected back to […]
The post DLR Validate Miniaturized Satellite Laser Ranging Solution appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: China’s Chang’e-7 moon mission to target Shackleton crater
summary: China will attempt to land on the illuminated rim of Shackleton crater near the lunar south pole with its 2026 Chang’e-7 mission.

title: Orbital Outpost X names Negar Feher CEO
summary: OOX announced the appointment of Feher, who has held management and technical roles at Lockheed Martin, Maxar Technologies, Momentus Space and SpaceRyde.

title: PLD Space wins Spanish government funding for Miura 5 launch vehicle
summary: PLD Space has secured 40.5 million euros ($43.8 million) from the Spanish government after completing a preliminary design review of its Miura 5 launch vehicle.

title: JAXA’s SLIM is Back To Work on the Moon
summary: JAXA’s Smart Lander for Investigating Moon, or SLIM, has resumed operations on the lunar surface. SLIM landed upside down because of an engine failure leaving the solar cells pointing in […]

title: Grasp instrument monitors Earth’s atmosphere and surface
summary: Grasp is moving ahead with plans to establish a 10-satellite constellation in the next four years.

title: CRS NG-20 preparing to launch cargo, science to ISS aboard Falcon 9
summary: The NG-20 mission is being readied to fly the Cygnus spacecraft S.S. Patricia Hilliard Robertson to the International Space Station. However, as a first, it is flying atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 instead of an Antares rocket. This will be the first of three Cygnus missions to fly aboard Falcon 9 for Northrop Grumman to fulfill its cargo delivery contract while the new Antares 330 is under development.
